results.description: Join us on Monday, 13th October 2025 at 6:30 PM for an inspiring session titled "GSoC Unlocked: Your Open Source Journey". Our distinguished speaker, Mr. Ayush Srivastava, Software Engineering Intern at Dograh, CTO of Merge Learning Pvt. Ltd., and Co-founder & CEO of Bithive Technologies, will guide you through the world of Google's Summer of Code (GSoC). Dive deep into Ayush's personal journey, gain insights into the essential technical skills for GSoC success, and discover how to make impactful open-source contributions. Don't miss the opportunity for an interactive Q&A session, where your questions meet Ayush's expertise. Whether you're a beginner or well-versed in tech, this session is your stepping stone to open-source success! RSVP now and be part of our vibrant GDG community.

results.description:
About this Competition

HackEVL is a two-phase innovation challenge for the students of SJEC that empowers students to pitch bold ideas, build impactful solutions, and demonstrate technical excellence.

Participants can choose from five exciting tracks:

  1. MeshWave ‚Äì Decentralized P2P Systems & Mesh Networking: Explore resilient, borderless connectivity through peer-to-peer communication, dynamic routing, and disaster-ready mesh networks.

  2. EmotionForge ‚Äì Emotion-Aware AI & Adaptive Experiences: Build technology that senses human emotions and adapts responses, from chatbots to AR/VR and mood-driven recommenders.

  3. SentinelX ‚Äì Next-Gen Defense Intelligence & Cyber Resilience: Design tools to predict, monitor, and defend against evolving cyber and physical security threats using AI and real-time intelligence.

  4. AetherMind ‚Äì Generative AI Agents & Autonomous Systems: Push the limits of autonomy by experimenting with multi-agent AI systems, self-governing task managers, and GenAI-powered orchestration.

  5. Open Innovation ‚Äì No Boundaries, Pure Creativity: A wildcard track where participants can propose any futuristic solution that blends creativity with real-world applicability.

The hackathon culminates with shortlisted teams pitching and demoing their solutions in front of industry experts. The winner takes home the prize pool and gets a direct opportunity for internships with Evlogia.

What We're Looking For

Phase 1 ‚Äì Idea Pitching (Deck Submission)

  • Select one track and submit an idea deck.

  • Evaluation will focus on:

  • Technical feasibility & execution plan (25%)

  • Business & impact potential (75%)

Phase 2 ‚Äì Solution Development & Final Demo

  • Shortlisted teams will:

  • Officially register.

  • Receive 5 problem statements in their chosen track.

  • Build a complete solution for one statement.

  • Evaluation will focus on:

  • Technical implementation (40%)

  • Functionality & completeness (20%)

  • Innovation in technical approach (15%)

  • User experience & design (10%)

  • Business & impact factors (15%)

The top 5‚Äì10 teams will then pitch and demo their solutions for the final prize.

Submission Format

Phase 1: Upload Idea Deck (PPT/PDF) via Knackify portal.

Phase 2: Upload Prototype video link, Code repository link, and Documentation Deck via Knackify.

Final Round: Deliver a live pitch + demo presentation to the jury.

Prizes
‚Çπ50,000 + Internship Opportunities at Evlogia
